												Ball3d (Formally know as Ball3D: Soccer Online) is a free to play soccer game that puts on the table a simple gameplay, a very modest grapichs scheme and a basic concept. Like in football (or soccer for this review sake) your goal is to get the ball inside of the opponent goal and prevent them to doing the same in yours. With this simple premise, the game throws you in the field with few tools, some teammates and a task to achive. Win the match.The gameplay is what makes the game interesting. The core mechanics are pretty basic, with LMB you load a bar and that bar sets the power of, in contact with the ball, it will be kicked. RMB or Space let you jump and you set the height by releasing the key at the right time and if you press Q or E while charging the kickbar the ball will curve in the air, making it harder to catch for the opposive team. This three are the base of all the gameplay in the game, plus WASD for movement.But the fun part is in the complex mechanics, for example: If you press Shift while you load the bar with LMB the ball will lob (or go straight up, if you dont know the concept). This can be used with Q or E to make amazing skills to dribble a defender away or make some space for a clear shot to goal. Beside this is the side-dribble mechanic (with the kickbar full, press Shift + A or D) to escape from a sticky situation or humiliate a defender who dares to challenge you.This concepts maybe seem basic, and thats the point. This game is not P2W, but rewards skill, teamplay, game sense and knowledge of the game in general and maybe its a bit overwhelming at first but give it a chance, it will take alot of your time away.

												Well. I'm playing this game since Autumn 2012, and just 2 months later i started streaming and commentating some official matches. Now i'm kind of retired commentator/streamer but still i'm playing this game to day and it's still a lot of fun. Game in actuall state is almost completly different from the very first version i ever played (except for some UI options and the fact that your avatar is a ... huge puck... living puck... this puck is breathing, has dreams, has life goals, some of them have also families, and some of those families consists of SMALL CUTE PUCKS... they are going to school, learn how to move, learn some basics about the world... then they starts playing football... they loving it... and soon they are football superstars playing on a huge stadium... where (virtual) people watching pucks.... playing ♥♥♥♥ing football... and so on). Back then there wasn't anything to control kicking the ball except for height and power (no ratotions, no shift kicking, no sliding the ball from one side of avatar to another, etc.), but now - it's dynamic, enjoyable and fun. A lot of changes has been made (to mechanics, behind the scenes, to interface), some of them were controversial, some were really good, some were really bad. But now, we are here!Alright, comming back to the "real" review:Main gamemode is football (or for americans: soccer), as its rules are really simple i'm not gonna even describe them (except for fact, that there are bounds). Very popular addition to this is "Real Football" where there are outs, goal kicks, corners. Of course there are other gamemodes (hockey, racing, basketball, etc.) but those are less popular.You can play the game with other people by joining rooms. Rooms can be created by any player (which we call "host" and granted automaticly admin rights - which can set any aspect of the match) with max 32 slots (good internet connection here is recommended for both host and client). Soon there will be dedicated servers which will be running 24/7, where everyone can play. Of course you can play with stupid as water in toilet (or great as a Greek god) bots, but i recommend it just for practice or when you NEED to play Ball3D without internet connection.According to networking code: it's good, obviously it can be better, but it's in good state, espiecially with optional antilag system. With antilag turned off: everything (ball, every avatar including YOURS) is being calculated and decided by host with no client-side calculations. What's that mean? For example, when you try to move your avatar, you will have to wait certain time to actually see this in-game (the higher latency to servers, the longer you will wait for "refresh"). With antilag turned on: everything (ball, every avatar including YOURS) is being calculated and decided by host like previously, but with client-sided calculations in the same time which are called "predictions". Simply, game is trying to predict what will happen in next x miliseconds, when there is no refresh from host, so you can move your avatar almost without this inputlag. In this case, stable internet connection is mandatory, since any issue can cause some weird situations (use at your own risk... I warned you).This game is about teamwork, but individual skills are important as well. You can't win just by rushing opponents goal and dribbling without passing, because soon or after - you will be rekt. Patience here is the key for winning, waiting for opponent to make a mistake. I said that individual skills are important as well. They are, especially when you are enforced to go 1v1 (doesnt matter if field player or GK) or if you want to score an amazing volley from almost any position (it's really difficult and you will see it very rare).Basicly this game is easy to play, hard to master. Many players, which i assumed they are completly new, wrote reviews and pointed out that this game is boring after some hours. It's like playing LoL. Everything is the same, except for a match which is unique. I know that LoL has much more depth, but Ball3D can be related to this in above case.There are many unofficial/official leagues and cups in many countries, and some are international so if you want to feel some competitiveness, your happiness will be fulfilled here. And there is one league already comming this September being sponsored from developer so don't miss it out!TL;DR If you really didn't read what i wrote, then you saved a lot of time which you can spent on Ball3D now :) If you did read: congratulations! You wasted your time!Now, go play this game. NOW!

												36/100Early TL;DR: Bad graphics, but it can be fun with friends.Through my ~30 minutes of playing, here's what I have to say about... uh... "Ball 3D: Soccer Online". The very first thing I noticed was the game didn't have any filters to nicknames. Honestly not a big deal, but filters of some kind should be in place, esspecially if children are playing the game. Now the next thing I'd like to say is that Ball 3D is not a good looking game, nor a good sounding one. The sound effects aren't the worst, but the menu music is not very enjoyable, to say the least. The game feels really slow paced because of how slow your character, or rather object, moves. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but could be boring for some. One issue I found was that it can be difficult to block shots, but I was told by a devoloper (Maniek in the comments for this review) that to block shots easier you should rapidly kick. Speaking of kicking, that's something I think this game did decently. You can kick the ball, and choose how hard you hit it, and you can choose to hit it straight up, or curve the shot to the left or right. I think that brings a little something into the game that makes it more interesting. The last thing I'd like to say about the game is that it will be much more enjoyable with a friend to play with. All in all, Ball 3D isn't that bad. The game is free, and very fast to download, so I'd suggest you get a few friends and try it for yourself.

												Although I haven't played with it that much but it was enough to realise the major flaws of this game.Servers are player hosted which means you will have double of your average ping compared to a proper server. Except if the host has a good connection.Since you have to create the rooms, you have to know how to do it (most importantly port forwarding). Some hosts fail and you can't connect to their rooms.The ball has weird physics. At one point the ball is slowly crawling forward and then 2 players touches it and suddenly skyrockets. After that the ball bounces 2 times max and is back to snail speed.Vertical camera movement is too restricted for my taste. I can't see anything because the camera is too close to the ground.You're most likely to get kicked by these self-entitled admins without explanation or because other players ("alpha-males") tell them to do so.Even though my experience with the community was 80% positive, I have to mention "those" experienced players coming to troll new ones in beginner servers who'll talk s*** if you happen to beat them. And that is pretty amusing if you think about it!I might still play this with my friend (you should try it out too as the game is just ~150mb) but I don't think I'd enjoy this game alone because of the reasons mentioned above.But yes, I recommend this game as it's fast to download and you can get right into the game but after that it's up to you if you keep playing with it or not.
